intro: Centropogon ovalifolius var. glabristamineus, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed centropogon, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its specific variety name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
